data.title: Outstanding Place and People
data.text: We had room number 5 on the second floor.  Upon arrival we were greeted by Garrett who gave us a nice tour and shared info on the house.  Beautiful facility.  This was a Tuesday night (election night in fact) and we had the entire house to ourselves.  You can roam around the house, make use of its resources and come and go as you please thanks to an electronic (but simple) access door lock.  The area is nice (a historic district) with a church across the street and an Art Museum next door.  We walked to dinner that night at a nearby eatery that was good.  Breakfast in the morning was one of 4 or 5 different options and you pick the time to be served.  Excellent food.  Overall rating?  Outstanding....would stay again if in the area.  Note that the Gilmore Auto Museum is just 20 minutes away...and if you are a car enthusiast, you must go there.  Best auto museum on the planet in my book, with 300 cars displayed in 10 different buildings on a beautiful campus.

data.title: Overnight Business Trip to Kalamazoo
data.text: Room was comfortable and breakfast was delicious.  Convenient to downtown restaurants and brew pubs.  Owners even provide growlers to take with you to local brew pubs to bring back and enjoy.  Highly recommend staying here.

data.title: Perfection!
data.text: I only stayed one night and wish I could have stayed longer. I usually don't sleep well away from home, but my room and the bed were luxurious perfection at really reasonable rates! Welcoming, immaculately clean, and exquisite attention to detail make this a great place to stay. They even leave you milk and cookies at bedtime!

data.title: Jim S
data.text: Stopped on trip to Detroit to visit a few breweries etc. Steve very helpful and rate no different then hotel down the street. Great room. Quiet and a nice breakfast in a very beautiful home. Wife and I will be back.

data.title: Charming and Beautiful
data.text: I initially planned a solo visit to the Kalamazoo house. When my boyfriend decided to join me last minute, Steve was more than accommodating. Upon arrival, we were given a key to our room, a tour of the property and a map with some recommendations for food and things to do. We were in room 10 on the third floor. The room had a desk, queen sized bed, fireplace, love-seat and bathroom with a deep soaking tub large enough for 2. The bed was so comfortable and tub was great. The dining area had a bar with growlers to borrow-so you can grab some amazing local beers and the common areas on the first and third floor have a coffee and tea station with a Kurig. There is also a mini fridge onsite with sodas, water and milk. After 9pm, cookies are left for each room. Breakfast was a choice of 5 options (all sounded delicious) and is made at a time you request. The Kalamazoo House was the first B&B I've been too and I couldn't be happier. Steve and Garret were extremely accommodating, the grounds and room are gorgeous and the location cannot be beat. Oh and it's right next to the Kalamazoo Institute of Art and across the street from Bronson Park. I cannot wait to come back!

data.title: Relaxing AND perfect to every detail
data.text: I came in for Homecoming.  Previously, I had some very mixed experiences at a different B&B years earlier.  This Kalamazoo House was outstanding!  I can't wait to have another reason to return and savor the many details of the house that the hosts have perfected.

data.title: Lovely, welcoming atmosphere
data.text: I recently spent one night at the Kalamazoo House B&B and enjoyed it thoroughly.  I was welcomed at the door by the owner, Steve, who made me feel like a special guest.  Compared to the sterile atmosphere of chain hotels, this was a breath of fresh air.  I was able to choose exactly which room I wanted online so there weren't any surprises.  Room 5 is quite roomy with a desk, armoire, two comfortable chairs, two nightstands, and an electric fireplace.  The bathroom has plenty of room for the sink, toilet, and jet tub with shower, although the lighting could be better for applying make up.  The king size bed couldn't have been more comfortable, and I had a quiet night's sleep. Breakfast the next morning was delicious and just the right size.  I chose the B&B, because it was downtown where I had a conference so I was able to walk and leave my car in their parking lot.

data.title: Beautiful
data.text: Beautiful home within walking distance to downtown.  Room was clean and comfortable; breakfast was delicious; great hospitality!  Wish we had more time to enjoy this beautiful home.  Cookies in the evening were an added treat!  Hope to return in the near future!

data.title: Charming and romantic. Can't wait to return!
data.text: My husband and I celebrated our third wedding anniversary by planning an "Under the Radar Michigan" weekend.  UTR is a show on PBS that celebrates places and things in Michigan that are cool and different to discover.  The Kalamazoo House was mentioned in the book, otherwise we would never have know about this quaint B&B.  From the moment we arrived we felt right at home.  Steve could not have been more welcoming and friendly.  Everything is there for your convenience and comfort, from the Keurig machine (available at all hours for a soothing tea or coffee along with cookies at night), the comfy robes hanging on the bathroom door, the most comfortable bed and sheets I think I've ever experienced, and of course the delicious made to order 5 star breakfast.  We loved every minute of our stay and are looking forward to a return visit when we can spend more time and explore other breweries and the art institute right next door.

data.title: Perfection!!
data.text: This B&B was one of a kind!  A beautifully restored Victorian home and service that can't be beat. The staff could not have been more informed and helpful and pulled out all the stops to make us feel at home and like royalty at the same time.  The room was beautifully appointed and had every amenity. They truly thought of everything we could have wanted. The location allowed us to walk around downtown and checkout local pubs and restaurants. Mini fridges and coffee service on our floor, fresh cookies in the evening and an outstanding breakfast made the stay a treat!! We will absolutely be back to bike the trails around Kalamazoo and enjoy this gem!

data.title: I wish I could live here!
data.text: This B&B is a beautifully restored and decorated Victorian house located near downtown and minutes from WMU & Kalamazoo College.  This was our second stay at the Kalamazoo House .  The other reviewers have raved about the hosts, the breakfast, (props to Garrett),  the service...and it's all true!  So I will just jot a few notes about the two rooms that we stayed in.  The first time we stayed in room #2 which is one of their smallest and least expensive rooms with a queen size bed.  We were very comfortable, perfect if you are not planning to spend a lot of time in the room as there aren't chairs to lounge in or a desk (but you can use the tables and chairs in the beautiful common areas downstairs).  The location of this room at the top of the stairs may be less than ideal if you are a light sleeper, like I am, since the the other guests have to pass by the room to get to theirs.  The second time, we stayed in room #11, which is also a queen size room but located on the third floor.  This room is a little larger and has two chairs for lounging and a desk and was very quiet.  However, since the room is on the third floor the ceiling was slanted in the bathroom, which was fine for me, but a little cramped for my tall husband.  I think next time (and there will definitely be a next time), we will splurge for one of the larger rooms.  Kalamazoo House is a delightful place to stay (when's the last time you said that about a Comfort Inn?) and we look forward to our next visit.

data.title: Perfect stay
data.text: My wife and I came here for our anniversary and had a perfect get away. We loved the room we stayed in and we were able to peek in a few others that were not occupied. Owners and staff were so nice and accommodating. The location is perfect for beer and blend food lovers. Very good breweries and restraunts are within easy walking distance. So many little touches inside the house that were delightful surprises. Would definitely recommend staying here over a hotel. We both still talk about our stay here.

data.title: If I could give it a higher rating...
data.text:
Incredible. Lovingly restored Victorian home. They thought of everything!! 
Perfect location. Personal service. 
You have full use of the various rooms around the house. There is a bar (BYOB) with glasses, ice etc. 
Breakfast is cooked to order. 
Gluten free products are available.
Next doot to the Art Institute. WAlking distance to many breweries and restaurants.
I can only echo everything that other reviewers have said.

data.title: AMAZING WEEKEND TRIP
data.text: We stayed at Kalamazoo House for 2 nights in September. It was such a great place to stay.  It is the perfect location and easy walking to fantastic dining options and brewery tours. Breakfast was amazing, as well as night milk and cookies. They have bottled water, pop, and keurig machines on 2 floors to help yourself to. We enjoyed the parlor area to sit and visit with friends one afternoon. It's so much better than a hotel room.  Steve was wonderful, very helpful with any questions. I even forgot my shoes and he shipped them to me.

data.title: 24 hour Anniversary trip
data.text: Wonderful, well-attended stay. Only had overnight to celebrate our 29th anniversary and this B&B was perfectly situated to walk to all brew pubs in the area.  24 hour access to coffee, tea, water, and soda was really nice, and the home-baked chocolate chip cookies in the evening were a sweet touch.  Had a King Whirlpool suite and completely enjoyed our Kalamazoo experience.

data.title: Beautifully restored B&B. Great find!
data.text: The Kalamazoo House B&B was built in the late 19th century. It's charm and character still exists today. We came to Kalamazoo to drop our son off at Western Michigan University. We planned to stay 2 nights but ended up staying 3. What a nice surprise finding this place. The owner Steve was very caring and helpful. He made sure our expectations were met, more than we even knew. The rooms were exceptionally clean and fully stocked with amenities. The breakfast was home made to order by signing up the night before, as we received homemade cookies from the chef. It's location makes it very convenient to walk to restaurants in the city. I plan to come back and enjoy the hospitality again. If you find yourself in Kalamazoo, this is the place to stay!

data.title: This place was FANTASTIC!!
data.text: My husband and I stayed one night and, oh, what a wonderful day and night!  The home itself is beautiful with lovely period pieces but what I loved most were all the thoughtful touches that the hosts provided.  We never met them in person but they provided so many little niceties to make you comfortable and at home:  the basket of toiletries in case you forgot anything, the bedside sound machine, the homemade cookies at night with your name on them, and many more.  Thank you Steve and Steph for a great time!

data.title: Beautiful Place!
data.text: I was in town for a wedding and thought it would be cool to stay someplace other than a commercial hotel.  Kalamazoo House was so lovely, clean, inviting and had excellent breakfasts.  Every detail, from the high quality sheets, the soaker tub to the cookies and milk at bedtime added to the experience.

data.title: Fabulous Place!
data.text: We were given an unexpected gift of staying here for two days while we attended a wedding. This place has so much historical character!  It is a beautiful place to stay and the customer service was stellar.  It was clear that the owner and others pay close attention to detail. There wasn't a thing I thought of that they hadn't already taken care of.  In most cases, I hadn't even thought about it but they had and that was what was so cool.  They are located very close to the downtown square so we were able to walk to most places we wanted to go.  This is an amazing place and if you get a chance you should book this place and not think twice about it.

data.title: Top notch, premiere - the BEST!
data.text:
From the time we made reservations and to arrival, the staff and Steve were most helpful and beyond expectations of accommodating us.  The rooms were excellent, peaceful setting and within easy distances to downtown.
The easy check in deserves A+++.  The entire welcome plan is explained, the website and follow up emails etc are most helpful.  
The breakfast plan is excellent - you get to select your choice the day before.  The options are many and really a nice touch to convenience.

This is a premiere location and B&B.  You cannot go wrong with this Inn.
Thank you Steve - it has been a great pleasure working with you and staying at the Inn.
